subject: Re: [junit] Essay: The Trouble With JUnit
msgSnippet: ... What if I told you that someone was working on a book that teaches object-oriented design /entirely/ through test-driven development? What if I told you
messageBody:
Brenda Fry wrote:
>
>
> Beginner here.
>
> I totally agree. The things I seem to need the most guidance in are
>
> - writing code that is easily test-able with plain old junit
> (and not cactus, since most everyone seems to frown on that)
>
> - and writing tests for existing code that wasn't written with
> unit testing in mind.
>
> Getting us to "think in junit" sums it up about right. That's the holy
> grail.
>
> Good luck with getting this off the ground.

What if I told you that someone was working on a book that teaches
object-oriented design /entirely/ through test-driven development? What
if I told you that such a book would likely have a Java version? Might
that help?
